fields.label: Advertiser Name
fields.help_text: The business or organization name that will appear on invoices and orders.

fields.label: Payment Terms
fields.help_text: How quickly the advertiser pays invoices. Common terms: Net 30 (30 days), Net 15 (15 days), Due on Receipt (immediate).

fields.label: Credit Limit
fields.help_text: Maximum amount the advertiser can owe at one time. Orders cannot be approved if they would exceed this limit.

fields.label: Tax ID
fields.help_text: Business tax identification number (EIN, SSN, or similar). Required for billing and tax reporting.

fields.label: Order Number
fields.help_text: Unique identifier for this order. Usually auto-generated but can be customized. Used for tracking and invoicing.

fields.label: Rate Type
fields.help_text: How spots will be scheduled: ROS (any time), Daypart (specific time periods), or Fixed Time (exact times).

fields.label: Spot Lengths
fields.help_text: Duration of commercials in seconds. Common lengths: 15, 30, or 60 seconds. You can select multiple lengths.

fields.label: Total Spots
fields.help_text: Total number of commercials to run during the order period. Traffic manager will schedule this many spots.

fields.label: Start Date
fields.help_text: First day commercials can air. Spots will be scheduled on or after this date.

fields.label: End Date
fields.help_text: Last day commercials can air. Spots will be scheduled on or before this date.

fields.label: Approval Status
fields.help_text: Current approval state: NOT_REQUIRED (auto-approved), PENDING (awaiting approval), APPROVED (ready for scheduling), or REJECTED (needs changes).

fields.label: Order Status
fields.help_text: Current state: DRAFT (being created), PENDING (submitted), APPROVED (ready for scheduling), ACTIVE (spots airing), COMPLETED (all spots aired), or CANCELLED.

fields.label: Scheduled Date
fields.help_text: The specific date this commercial will air.

fields.label: Scheduled Time
fields.help_text: The specific time this commercial will air (e.g., 8:00 AM).

fields.label: Break Position
fields.help_text: Where in the commercial break this spot plays: A (first), B (second), C (third), etc. A-position spots are premium.

fields.label: Daypart
fields.help_text: Time period when spot airs: Morning Drive (6-10 AM), Midday (10 AM-3 PM), Afternoon Drive (3-7 PM), Evening (7 PM-Midnight), or Overnight (Midnight-6 AM).

fields.label: Spot Status
fields.help_text: Current state: SCHEDULED (ready to air), AIRED (has aired), MISSED (didn't air - may need makegood), or CANCELLED.

fields.label: Clock Template
fields.help_text: The template that defines the structure of each hour. Select the appropriate template for the date and programming type.

fields.label: Target Date
fields.help_text: The date for which you're generating the daily log. Logs are created one day at a time.

fields.label: Preview
fields.help_text: Preview shows what the log will look like before generating. Review timing, spot placement, and overall flow.

fields.label: Publish
fields.help_text: Publishing sends the log to LibreTime automation system. Once published, the log is locked and cannot be edited.

fields.label: Invoice Number
fields.help_text: Unique identifier for this invoice. Usually auto-generated. Used for tracking and payment reference.

fields.label: Invoice Date
fields.help_text: Date the invoice is created. Used to calculate due date based on payment terms.

fields.label: Due Date
fields.help_text: Date payment is due. Calculated from invoice date plus payment terms (e.g., Net 30 = 30 days after invoice date).

fields.label: Payment Terms
fields.help_text: How quickly payment is expected: Net 30 (30 days), Net 15 (15 days), Due on Receipt (immediate).

fields.label: Invoice Status
fields.help_text: Current state: DRAFT (not sent), SENT (emailed to customer), PAID (fully paid), PARTIAL (partially paid), or OVERDUE (past due date).

fields.label: Audio File
fields.help_text: Upload the commercial audio file. Supported formats: MP3, WAV. File must match spot length (15, 30, or 60 seconds).

fields.label: Script Text
fields.help_text: For live reads, enter the script the DJ will read. Include instructions for tone, emphasis, and pronunciation.

fields.label: Expiration Date
fields.help_text: Date after which this copy should no longer be used. Prevents outdated commercials from airing.

fields.label: Campaign Name
fields.help_text: Name for this marketing campaign. Groups related orders and copy together for tracking and reporting.

fields.label: Daypart Name
fields.help_text: Descriptive name for this daypart (e.g., 'Morning Drive', 'Prime Time'). Use clear, industry-standard names.

fields.label: Start Time
fields.help_text: When this daypart begins (e.g., 06:00 for 6:00 AM). Spots scheduled in this daypart will only air during this time period.

fields.label: End Time
fields.help_text: When this daypart ends (e.g., 10:00 for 10:00 AM). Spots scheduled in this daypart will only air before this time.

fields.label: Daypart Category
fields.help_text: Optional category to group related dayparts together (e.g., 'Prime Time', 'Off-Peak'). Helps organize and filter dayparts.

fields.label: Description
fields.help_text: Optional notes about this daypart, its audience, pricing, or special characteristics.

fields.label: Category Name
fields.help_text: Name for this daypart category (e.g., 'Prime Time', 'Off-Peak', 'Drive Time'). Use clear, descriptive names.

fields.label: Rotation Rule Name
fields.help_text: Descriptive name for this rotation rule. Helps identify the rule's purpose (e.g., 'Campaign A - 30 Min Separation').

fields.label: Minimum Separation
fields.help_text: Minimum time (in minutes) between spots. Prevents spots from playing too close together. Typical: 30-60 minutes.

fields.label: Max Per Hour
fields.help_text: Maximum number of spots that can play in one hour. Prevents over-saturation. Leave blank for no limit.

fields.label: Sales Rep Name
fields.help_text: Name or username for this sales representative. Used to identify who is responsible for orders and accounts.

fields.label: Spec Spot
fields.help_text: Check this box to create a spec spot (speculative spot) - a production order without an associated sales order. Use for pitches, demos, or speculative work before client commitment. Spec spots are marked with 'SPEC' type and can be converted to regular orders later.

fields.label: Station
fields.help_text: Select which station this log is for. Required - each log belongs to a specific station. Clock templates must belong to the selected station.

fields.label: Station
fields.help_text: Select which station to schedule spots for. Required - spots must be assigned to a station. This determines which inventory, dayparts, and break structures are available.

fields.label: Station
fields.help_text: Select which station this order line applies to. Required - each order line specifies which station will air the spots. Multi-station orders have multiple order lines.

fields.label: LibreTime API URL
fields.help_text: The API endpoint URL for this station's LibreTime instance. If set, this station will use its own LibreTime configuration. If not set, the station will use global LibreTime settings.

fields.label: LibreTime API Key
fields.help_text: Authentication key for this station's LibreTime API. Required if using station-specific LibreTime configuration. Keep this secure.

fields.label: LibreTime Public URL
fields.help_text: Public-facing URL for this station's LibreTime instance. Used for links and references. Optional but recommended.
